case_vignette: A 14-year-old male with history of leukemia treated with chemotherapy underwent hematopoietic stem cell transplant and on day 30 post therapy was noted to have a rash on the trunk that rapidly spread to the hands, feet, ears! Patient was also reported to have fevers, chills, diarrhea and new transaminitis!  Examination remarkable for acral erythema and scattered pink erythematous macules and poorly demarcated papules on the trunk, extremities with prominent follicular erythema!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my trunk, hands, feet, and ears, along with fevers, chills, and diarrhea.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms since day 30 post therapy.
What specific therapy did you undergo 30 days ago?
I underwent a hematopoietic stem cell transplant.
Do you have any symptoms like mouth sores or eye redness?
No, I do not have mouth sores or eye redness.
Are the rashes itchy and are there any blisters?
The rashes are not itchy and there are no blisters.
Final Diagnosis: Acute Graft-versus-Host Disease (GvHD)

Hello! I have a rash that started on my trunk and spread to my hands, feet, and ears, and I've been experiencing fevers, chills, and diarrhea.

I've been experiencing these symptoms since day 30 post-therapy.

Final Diagnosis: Acute Graft-versus-Host Disease (GVHD)
